meanings.definition: A wild or untamed person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The warrigals roamed freely in the forest, untamed and wild.
meanings.sent2: The explorer encountered a group of warrigals deep in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The warrigals played a game of hide-and-seek with the forest creatures.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit was like a warrigal, untamed and fierce.
meanings.sent5: The howls of the warrigals echoed through the night, haunting and wild.

meanings.definition: A person who is fierce or aggressive.
meanings.sent1: The warrigals in the competition showed great determination and fierceness.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a warrigal in the debate club for her aggressive arguments.
meanings.sent3: The warrigals at the meeting argued passionately about the topic.
meanings.sent4: His competitive spirit made him a true warrigal on the field.
meanings.sent5: The warrigals in the courtroom fought for justice with fiery determination.

meanings.definition: A wild or untamed area or region.
meanings.sent1: The warrigals of the desert stretched endlessly, untouched by civilization.
meanings.sent2: Explorers ventured into the warrigals of the unknown land, seeking adventure.
meanings.sent3: The warrigals of the national park were home to diverse wildlife.
meanings.sent4: In the warrigals of the mountains, nature reigned supreme.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the warrigals captivated the hearts of all who visited.
